bibl.title: Letter from Jefferson Randolph Kean to Philip Showalter Hench, September 19, [1941]

div1.p: Kean states Carter was not in Cuba during the yellow fever experiments. He believes Truby's second manuscript is vastly improved.

div1.head: Letter from Jefferson Randolph Kean to Philip Showalter Hench, September 19, [1941]
div1.opener:
2804 N STREET, N. W.
WASHINGTON, D.C.
Sept. 19
My dear Dr. Hench
div1.p:
Thanks for your little
note of the 15th What a good filing
system you must have ever
to keep track of your multitudi-
nous papers ! If you have had
an opportunity to look at the
papers which I sent to you
recently to read and return,
did you notice the answer to
your question about Dr. Henry
R. Carter by himself, as to his
stay in Havana. That he was
not there at the time & so knew very little
about Reed's mosquito work.
I sent his daughter's letter as well
AC
K
2
as his own, which (former) shows that
he was sick and had to leave
in July, before the mosquito
work began. And the letter
of Dr. L. O. Howard with its
quotation from a letter of Major
Reed's will also interest you.
If in looking through your photo-
graphs, of which you must have
thousands, you come a cross the
photograph of my portrait which
was hung in the Secretaria de
Sanidad y Beneficencia will you
please send that back too-
Mrs Kean says it did not
come back in the bond box with
my diary and she is demanding
it. Now don't turn your office
3
upside down over it but just take a
look, or have your Secretary, who I know
is very efficient to look. It is a
small profile 6′ × 4′ I should say at a
guess.

I wrote to Gen. Truby, who sent the copy
of his memoir on Walter Reed & Yellow Fever
to Dr. Pinto & intends to send it to you
later, that he must not let Pinto keep
it long, but must hurry him to return
it so that you could have it. I am
impatient that you should see it. It is a
vast improvement over the hasty memorandum
that he formerly sent you. Your urging that
he send more details than that had has had
a good effect. I am going now to Wilming-
ton Del. for a 4 day visit.

closer.seg:
Gen Ireland & Miss Laura Wood as well as I
have read the copy Truby sent me. It is now
being read by the executive officer of the
S. G. O. Col. John Rogers as we want the Surgeon
General to publish it as a Bulletin of his
office.
